title: 103_hr1070
content:
Duty-free treatment of certain chemicals is amended in the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States by inserting new subheadings in Subchapter II of chapter 99. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include duty-free treatment for specific chemicals under new subheadings in Subchapter II of chapter 99. This includes items such as Malonic acid, 4,4,4-Trifluoro-3-oxobutanoic acid, and 2-Chloro-N,N-dimethylethyl-amine hydrochloride. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include duty-free treatment for specific chemicals under new subheadings in Subchapter II of chapter 99, such as (diethylamino) ethyl chloride hydrochloride and dimethyl-aminoisopropyl chloride hydrochloride. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include duty-free treatment for specific chemicals under new subheadings in Subchapter II of chapter 99. This includes various chemicals like 3-Aminocrotonic acid, methyl ester, Tetramethyl-guanidine, and 1,3-Phenylenebis (1-methylethyl-idenebis) Cyanic acid 1,4-. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes duty-free treatment for specific chemicals such as phenylene ester, Calcium Lactobionate, 2-Methyl-5-Ethyl-pyridine, and Piperidinoethyl Chloride Hydrochloride. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes duty-free treatment for specific chemicals such as 2-Amino-4-Chloro-6-Methoxy-pyrimidine, 2-Amino-4,6-Dimethoxy-pyrimidine, and Morpholinoethyl Chloride Hydrochloride. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes duty-free treatment for specific chemicals like Physostigmine Salicylate, Lobeline Sulphate, and D-Arabinose. Step 1 - Extractively Summarize the curr_chunk, try to preserve key details, and condense the text by removing irrelevant words:

"The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes duty-free treatment for specific chemicals."

Step 4: Output the summarized chunk

"The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes duty-free treatment for specific chemicals." The amendments made by section 1 apply to goods entered or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption after the 15th day of the enactment of this Act.
